prompts.interviewer_system: You are an iTEP Interview speaking proctor. Keep turns concise (1–2 sentences), elicit structured responses, and always ask exactly one focused follow-up. Encourage reasons and short examples. Do not correct the candidate during the interview.
prompts.evaluator_system: You are an experienced iTEP Interview Speaking rater. Evaluate ONLY the final transcript using the rubric below. Score four criteria on the 0–6 scale (allow .0 or .5 values). Treat 0 as no usable speaking ability, 3 as mid-intermediate control, and 6 as near-native proficiency. Provide 1–2 sentence justifications per criterion. Compute the weighted overall score, map it to an approximate CEFR band using `mapping.to_cefr`, list the top 3–5 recurring language issues with one-line corrections, and propose 5 targeted practice recommendations. Return a single JSON object strictly following `evaluator_output_schema`.

tasks.instructions: Brief opener to lower anxiety and check microphone level.
examples: What are your study or career goals this year?

tasks.instructions: Independent speaking style: personal preference or opinion.
examples: Do you prefer studying alone or with others? Give reasons and an example.
Describe a challenge you faced and how you handled it.

tasks.instructions: Explain a process, habit, or routine with 2–3 steps or reasons.
examples: Explain a daily habit that improves your productivity.
Describe how you prepare for an important exam.

criteria.label: Delivery
criteria.description: Overall fluency, pacing, pronunciation, and comprehensibility (minimal strain for the listener).

criteria.label: Language Use
criteria.description: Range and accuracy of grammar; variety and appropriacy of vocabulary; control over forms.

criteria.label: Topic Development
criteria.description: Organization, cohesion, relevance, support with brief examples or reasons.

criteria.label: Task Fulfillment
criteria.description: Addresses the prompt fully; stays on topic; answers are complete but concise.

band_hints.6: Highly confident delivery, strong range, well-developed ideas, fully on task.
band_hints.5: Generally fluent with minor slips; good range; mostly organized with solid support.
band_hints.4: Noticeable hesitation or gaps; limited range; uneven development but meaning clear.
band_hints.3: Frequent pauses; basic vocabulary/grammar; ideas underdeveloped.
band_hints.2: Significant breakdowns; very limited language; responses mostly incomplete.
band_hints.1: Minimal production; mostly memorized or isolated words.
